title: Business Live: Wall Street trading higher - BBC News

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for today on business live - thanks for reading .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on friday .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: wall street closes higher
text: us markets surged on thursday as technology stocks rebounded after a torrid week .
the dow jones industrial average closed 1.31 % higher at 24,159.98 points , while the s & p 500 gained 1.4 % to 2,641.46 .
the tech rich nasdaq composite added 1.64 % to 7,063.45 .
tech firms facebook , apple , alphabet and microsoft all chalked up gains while the s & p 500 tech index climbed 1.4 % , having fallen sharply earlier this week .

documents.title: how do londoners feel about brexit ?
text: how do londoners feel about brexit ?

documents.title: in case you missed it
text: uber has settled with the family of a woman that was killed by its self-driving vehicle in arizona .
elaine herzberg , 49 , died after being hit by an uber self-driving suv while walking across a road in phoenix earlier this month .
terms of the settlement have not been released , and the lawyer representing ms herzberg 's daughter and husband said the matter has been resolved .

documents.title: trump 's latest thoughts on trade
text: us president donald trunp has been busy today .
he 's decided to suspend rwanda 's duty-free status on clothing imports , as the country has imposed barriers to clothing exports from the us .
he 's also decided to withhold a trade deal with south korea , if the republic does n't reach an agreement with north korea on denuclearisation .

documents.title: worst quarterly performance of global stocks in 2.5 years
text: global stocks are not doing well right now , to the extent that many indices could see their weakest quarters since 2015 .
in march , the ftse 100 was down 8 % and the s & p 500 was down 1.4 % , while the ftse all world index was down 1.6 % in the year to 29 march .
and of course , the nasdaq has been down 3.1 % this quarter thanks to various problems affecting tech giants like amazon and facebook .

documents.title: microsoft restructures windows group
text: microsoft has restructured its windows operating system division , leading to the departure of windows and devices chief terry myerson .
microsoft 's chief executive satya nadella is making changes to help the firm to focus on software for cloud computing and artificial intelligence .

the windows engineering team will be split in two - half of the team will join a division that oversees all of microsoft 's software platforms , while the other half of the team that handles windows user interface will join a unit focusing on experiences and devices across the firm .
rajesh jha , who was in charge of office , will head up the experiences and devices team , while scott guthrie will oversee the enlarged cloud computing and ai group .

documents.title: iphone update adds privacy 'transparency '
text: apple has updated its ios , macos and tvos operating systems to give people more information about how their personal data is collected and used .
after updating , customers will see new information screens when they use apple-made apps that collect personal data , such as app store .
the change comes ahead of new eu data protection rules , which take effect on 23 may .
apple also plans to let people download the data it has stored about them .
read more

documents.title: will scottish gin find brexit a tonic or a bitter lemon ?
text: scottish gin is enjoyed by customers across europe , but how will its export to the trendy bars of vienna be affected by brexit ?
whisky may be scotland 's biggest export but there is an increasing demand for scottish gin .
according to leah shaw-hawkins , 70 % of the uk 's gin is made in scotland , including a lot of the big brands .

documents.title: wall street still rising
text: the dow jones industrial average is now 262.5 points or 1.1 % higher at 24,110.96 .
walt disney leads the winners , up 2.2 % .
the s & p 500 has risen 1.1 % to 2,633.72 , led by health insurance intermediary firm centene corp , up 5.6 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has recovered - it is now up 107 points at 7,056.36 .
sorrento therapeutics and dropbox top the index , rising 10.3 % and 8.1 % respectively .

documents.title: volkswagen class action lawsuit likely to go ahead
text: the biggest class action lawsuit in british history is likely to receive the go-ahead , a london court has indicated .

about 60,000 car owners are suing german carmaker volkswagen over the emissions scandal , which saw software fitted into 11 million cars to cheat us diesel emissions tests designed to limit air pollution .
the lawsuit will be handled by slater and gordon , as well as leigh day .
although volkswagen has paid millions in fines and compensation to us drivers , it has not compensated british drivers .
about 1.2 million vw , audi , skoda and seat vehicles are affected in the uk .

documents.title: rain on your easter paradesomeone at money transfer firm ofx is feeling chipper
text: have a happy easter despite the weather forecast which looks set to dampen uk growth and weigh on gbp

documents.title: carnival cruise offers teen free trip for snapchat handle
text: carnival cruise line has convinced a 15-year-old teenager in the us state of virginia to trade his snapchat handle for a free family cruise .
darian lipscomb of prospect , virginia , was surprised to find company representatives at his home requesting his @ twitterid name .
`` i answered the door , walked outside and saw my name on a big truck , '' the teenager told local media .
in exchange the company offered a free trip to spain for his family .

documents.title: one year to go : your questions on brexit answered
text: one year to go : your questions on brexit answered full story :
when will some people that voted to remain stop complaining about the result of the referendum ?

documents.title: insurer bumps up wagesscotland economy editor tweets
text: as jobs market tightens , direct line hikes lowest pay 5 % to £ 18k for 37.5 hours in a call centre + £ 500 share bonus .
expect more of this , using pay to recruit + retain : moreso with fewer eu27 citizens .
talking of which , read this :
yet last i heard net uk immigration was still over quarter of a million .
in one year .
nice read .

documents.title: london closes higher on gkn takeover
text: london shares have ended slightly ahead , led by british engineering giant gkn , which has succumbed to a hostile takeover bid from turnaround firm melrose .
the ftse 100 closed up 11.9 points or 0.17 % at 7,056.61 .
gkn topped the winners , rising 6.4 % to 450.07p .
the ftse 250 also ended on a high , climbing 103.9 points or 0.54 % to 19,460.47 , led by intellectual property commercialisation firm ip group .
it was up 7 % to 115p after reporting that its portfolio doubled in value in 2017 .

documents.title: breakinggkn loses independence battle to melrose
text: melrose industries has won control of the uk engineering giant gkn .
the investment company said it had the support of approximately 52.43 % of gkn investors .
melrose , which specialises in turning around manufacturing companies , had offered £ 8.1bn for the company .

christopher miller , chairman of melrose said : `` we are delighted and grateful to have received support from gkn shareholders for our plan to create a uk industrial powerhouse with a market capitalisation of over £ 10 billion and a tremendous future .
`` we are looking forward to working with gkn 's talented workforce and to delivering for customers and all stakeholders .
melrose has made commitments as to investment in r & d , skills and people and we are very excited about putting these into action .
`` let me assure you that gkn is entering into very good hands . ''

documents.title: air passengers sending bailiffs to airlines
text: bailiffs are being sent into airline offices because companies are failing to pay passengers compensation for flight delays and cancellations , bbc radio 4 's you and yours has learned .
thousands of court rulings ordering compensation have been ignored by airlines , including easyjet and thompson airways ( now tui airways ) .
in one case bailiffs boarded a plane .
easyjet says it is changing its policies about claims , while tui airways has launched an investigation .

documents.title: a positive view on sainsbury 's
text: supermarket shares have been leading the charge on the ftse 100 today .
we explained in an earlier post why analysts at bernstein were so keen on morrisons shares .
( it 's the dividend ) .
over at jefferies they are keen on sainsbury 's .
jefferies analysts recently met the management at sainsbury 's and found they were confident that they would meet profit expectations this year .
that confidence is down to cost savings and `` a more disciplined approach to pricing '' .
jefferies also notes that sainsbury 's is having success promoting new exclusive brands , including godiver and l'atelier chocolate .
the research note was also positive about the introduction of argos into sainsbury 's .
sainsbury 's shares are up 2 % .

documents.title: will there be a tax rise ?
text: pm says there will be more money for priorities `` like the nhs and schools '' after # brexit .
but @ twitterid refuses to rule out a tax rise to fund the health service
instead of just saying that there will be more money , can she actually prove it ?
because all the impact reports that have been released have stated the contrary .
there is no # brexit that will create more money for our health service unless more cuts are made or they increase tax
there is already a tax to fund the nhs - it 's called national insurance !
which is nowhere enough to cover the # nhs as it is today and the demands on it
so change that instead of bring in yet another tax !
people do n't like or want taxation but want the nhs therefore if a specific tax is imposed and ring fenced that would guarantee funding
then ni should be reduced !
another bbc produced party political broadcast for the conservative party .
idiot ! ! !
bot
says the cartoon plastic guy classic
idiot
if the impact assessments are half-right the loss in revenue will be greater than the money saved in contributions .
also regulatory bodies now at a european level ( eg medicines agency ) will have to be replicated at uk level .
much more expensive .
i know of no calculations on that .
brazen dishonesty !
until now i 've had sympathy for may , surrounded by # brexit zealots .
she must be suffering from # stockholmsyndrome , as she 's boarded the big red bus of lies .
brexit makes us poorer .
less trade = lower tax receipts = less £ for # nhs .
there is no brexit dividend
i 've never had sympathy for her .
she is the pm she is obviously as rw as any other zealot esp on fom ( she was always desperate to stop this to extent she ignored/cared not to consider effect on economy ) .
leaving sm will make country poorer ; there will be less tax revenue/money

documents.title: wall street opens higher
text: wall street shares have opened higher as tech stocks recover some lost ground from wednesday .

the dow jones industrial average has risen 157.4 points or 0.66 % to 24,005.77 , led by procter and gamble , rising 2 % to $ 80.46 on the news that model chrissy teigen is joining the firm as brand ambassador .
the s & p 500 has climbed 16.4 points or 0.63 % to 2,621.56 .
top of the winners is pvh corp , up 6.5 % to $ 153.41 after announcing an increase in fourth quarter profit .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq is flat - just 6.5 points or 0.09 % lower to 6,944.43 .

the losers are led by data broker acxium corp , plunging 24.3 % to $ 21.23 due to facebook announcing yesterday it will stop letting advertisers use information from third-party data brokers for targeted ads .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks dearbail and karen for this morning 's live coverage of all things business .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views .
got a point of view ?
tweet me at @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: morrisons : 'the underdog of food retail '
text: so why are analysts at bernstein so positive about morrison supermarkets ?
well , they say it is becoming a great income earner for investors as dividend yields will double over the coming years .
bernstein also likes the way the company is managed .
`` the management team have under-promised and over-delivered for the last 3 years .
earnings are steadily being revised upward .
that has actually been morrisons ' fate for the last 20 years .
`` it is the underdog of food retail , where execution beats strategy , '' the research report said .

documents.title: breakingbarclays agrees $ 2bn penalty in us mortage backed securities case
text: barclays has agreed to pay $ 2bn to settle a civil action brought by us authorities over the sale of mortgage-backed securities , the us department of justice has said .
the us alleged `` barclays caused billions of dollars in losses to investors '' by selling the deals .

documents.title: supermarkets lead the ftse 100 higher
text: the ftse 100 is firmly in positive territory , up 0.3 % , with supermarkets among the top five winners .
sainsbury 's is up 2.7 % and morrison supermarkets is also 2.7 % higher .
morrison shares benefited from some positive comments by analysts at bernstein .

documents.title: any questions about money matters ?
text: ever feel baffled or confused by economics , business or personal finance ?
we cover all sorts of stories on @ twitterid # wakeuptomoney and on monday we 'll be taking your questions .
let us know if there 's anything you do n't understand and we 'll do our best to explain it .
@ twitterid
gosh .
that 's nice to know .
do you think melrose ( mro ) will be 300p by xmas ?

last i heard he was tipping tesco at 300p+ # justsaying # gissusajob

2. why is every daytime advert about over 50s insurance for funerals ?

documents.title: tourism industry 'will still need eu migrants '
text: one year before britain 's formal departure from the eu , cumbria 's tourism industry is looking further ahead to the end of the transition period , when free movement of workers ends .
the industry , cumbria 's largest employer , has always depended on bringing workers in from elsewhere in the country or the world .
nigel wilkinson , of windermere lake cruises , says an estimated 10,000 eu workers fill jobs which might otherwise stay vacant because there is almost full employment in the county .
the concern is what happens if that migrant labour pool contracts . ''

documents.title: fake bank branch arrest in india
text: police in india say they have arrested a man for running a fake bank branch in the northern state of uttar pradesh , reports bbc world service .
more than $ 2,000 ( £ 1,400 ) was seized , along with paperwork revealing the existence of savings accounts and fixed deposits made by trusting local customers .
police raided the office of the man who claimed to be the general manager .
the accused - aafaq ahmed - had taken the name vinod kumar kambali , modelled apparently on the name of a prominent former test cricketer , vinod kambli .
he was found in his office , with five other employees working diligently on their computers when the police came looking .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: s4c to lose uk government funding by 2022
text: all public money for s4c will come from the tv licence fee within four years , the uk government has said .
it currently provides about 8 % of the channel 's £ 84m budget - £ 6.672m - with 90 % coming from the licence fee and 2 % from s4c 's own commercial income .
the uk contribution is guaranteed until 2020 , but from 2022 s4c funding will be decided in the licence fee settlement .
s4c chairman huw jones said he welcomed `` the government 's wish to secure s4c 's funding stability for the long term '' .
read more here

he tweets :

unlike others , they pay little or no taxes to state & local governments , use our postal system as their delivery boy ( causing tremendous loss to the u.s. ) , and are putting many thousands of retailers out of business !

documents.title: vw parks cars at 37 us facilities
text: volkswagen has taken car parks to a whole new level in the us - and will not be emptying them soon .
the german car giant paid more than $ 7.4bn to buy back about 350,000 us diesel vehicles up to mid-february , a recent court filing shows .
vw has been storing hundreds of thousands of vehicles around the us for months , reuters reports .
volkswagen has 37 secure storage facilities around the us including a suburban detroit american football stadium , a former minnesota paper mill and a desert lot near victorville in california .

documents.title: where 's best for women , east or west ?
text: is it easier to be a businesswoman in the west or in asia ?
this is one woman 's experience

documents.title: government reversal on housing costs
text: the government has reversed a policy that prevents some 18 to 21-year-olds from receiving help with housing costs through the universal credit system .
universal credit is being introduced gradually and merges a number of benefits - including housing benefit - into one .
it has been the case that only some 18 to 21-year-olds meeting certain criteria would be eligible for help with housing costs .
now it will offer the housing element of universal credit for all 18 to 21-year-olds receiving the benefit .
housing charity shelter said the previous rule had create a risk of homelessness for many young adults , and it was `` thrilled '' with the government 's change of mind .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: scope for spending narrows
text: commenting on gdp for the fourth quarter and last year , pwc 's chief economist john hawksworth said : `` among the g7 , the uk was the only economy to see a deceleration in growth between 2016 and 2017 , which does point to the dampening impact of brexit-related uncertainty on uk business investment and the squeeze on consumers from the weaker pound pushing up uk import prices in 2017 . ''
he said there was some up between the first and second halves of 2017 and for this year the uk economy will expand at around 1.5 % .

but he said : `` against this there is less additional scope for households to boost spending through higher borrowing , bearing in mind that the household savings ratio reached a record low of 4.7 % in 2017 and that interest rates are expected to edge up gradually during 2018 and beyond . ''

documents.title: gkn 's shares gain ground
text: the fate of britain 's biggest engineering group , gkn , will soon be decided .
investors have been voting on whether to stay independent or come under the control of turnaround specialist melrose industries .
ahead of the crunch announcement gkn 's shares are trading higher .
shortly after midday they were up by nearly 0.6 % at 425.4p each .

documents.title: lots of collective fun
text: on wednesday , the bbc reported that filling this year 's panini world cup sticker book would cost £ 773.60 .
5 live 's sam walker boasts that she once filled an entire smash hits sticker album - which included this of amazulu , the songstrels behind 1980s pop hit too good to be forgotten .
5 live would like to know what you have obsessively collected ?
ceramic pigs ?
decorative toby jugs ?
or perhaps empty pizza boxes ?
that last one is n't a joke .

today a prof from cardiff uni has worked out it will cost over £ 700 to do the same for the world cup album this year .

we used to buy a box , tear the packets , sort them and put them in the book all before my mom got back at 5:15 .

after she passed we found stacks of them in the pantry , all cleaned out , pristine and ready for god only knows what .

the twitter community has been great for unearthing a few hard to find ones .
dimwits .

documents.title: london stocks inch ahead
text: let 's check in on the london markets this lunchtime - and the ftse 100 has gained a little more ground ahead of the easter weekend .
it 's now at 7,070.44 , that 's a rise of 26 points or nearly 0.4 % .
the ftse 250 is at 19,430.34 , up 74 points or nearly 0.4 % .

documents.title: bonus pay gap revealed at facebook uk
text: women working for facebook 's uk division get nearly half the amount of bonus pay than their male counterparts , despite a similar proportion of each sex getting some kind of top-up award .
the median gender bonus pay gap at the business is 41.5 % , according to figuressubmitted to the government .
however , the equivalent gap for hourly pay was much smaller - 9.9 % .
that means when comparing median hourly rates , facebook 's female staff earn 90p for every £ 1 that its men earn .
read more here .

documents.title: hopes rise in cumbria as formal brexit nears
text: with a year to go before britain formally leaves the eu , some cumbrian businesses say they are increasingly hopeful britain will reach a good deal .

john coughlan , the chief operating officer of tsp engineering in workington and a board member of cumbria 's local enterprise partnership , says he 's now `` five out of 10 '' in terms of confidence the right trade deal will be reached .
i 'm right in the middle at the moment because i do see a change in how the government ministers are approaching the negotiations but it all depends on how they continue . ''
dairy farmer mark allison , from greencroft farm near cockermouth , says there must be as little disruption as possible .
uncertainty with how the uk 's going trade with the rest of europe is a massive factor for us . ''
author: Bob Cooper
Political reporter, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: sky launches plastics crisis investment vehicle
text: media giant sky has launched an investment vehicle called sky ocean ventures to put money into ideas that can help alleviate the crisis of plastics in the world 's oceans .

sky ocean ventures will start out with £ 25m , and is particularly interested in hearing from entrepreneurs and businesses `` who are developing plastic packaging alternatives , new tech for the home that will help assist recycling and those developing alternative fibres for clothing , '' it says .

documents.title: budget pressures squeezing savings
text: official figures for 2017 show budget pressures are squeezing families ' savings and pushing them to borrow .
saving is at its lowest level since 1963 , while households have become net borrowers for the first time since records began .
the office for national statistics said the amount households saved out of their disposable income fell to an annual record low of 4.9 % last year .
that 's the result of spending growing faster than money coming in .
households become net borrowers on average if the amount of debt they are building up exceeds the amount they are salting away , in bank accounts for instance .
and on that measure , households were net borrowers in 2017 for the first time since records began in 1987 , following five consecutive quarters of slipping into the red .
the ons has already described the savings ratio as falling to a record low on a quarterly basis .
today 's lowest level '' refers to the annual rate .
before the 2017 low of 4.9 % , the previous low was 5.2 % in 1971 .
author: Simon Gompertz
BBC personal finance correspondent

documents.title: amazon sponsors channel 4 's bake off
text: amazon is to sponsor the second series of channel 4 's the great british bake off
the sponsorship will also cover bake off : an extra slice , any festive episodes and bake off : the professionals .
last year 's sponsors were lyle 's golden syrup and dr oetker .
amazon is particularly keen to use the deal to promote its echo 's speakers and the capabilities of voice service alexa .

documents.title: uk hopes to 'roll over ' 40 eu trade deals
text: the uk hopes to have 40 trade arrangements with 70 countries in place by the end of the brexit transition period in 2020 , the international trade secretary has said .
liam fox told bbc radio 4 's today programme he hoped to `` roll over '' the arrangements from the eu agreements .
he said all those countries had been spoken to and had agreed they would like that outcome .
the uk is set to stick with current eu trade deals during the transition .
the uk is due to leave the eu on 29 march , 2019 , with the proposed transition period - during which most of the current trade arrangements would continue - set to last until 31 december , 2020 .
read the full story here

documents.title: savings ratio hits 14 year low
text: household saving ratio fell to annual record low of 4.9 % in 2017 ( records since 1963 ) + households were net borrowers for first time since records began in 1987 .
office for nat stats
potentially two reasons for that : 1 .
people more confident about the future , so borrowing to buy items etc .
people needing to borrow to keep their heads above water on a daily basis .
wonder which it is ?
equally it could be well-off households saving less due to inflation .
'heads above water ' is a popular emotive term , but the majority of the population are able to juggle spending between different items , which is why the restaurant trade is on its ass right now
low interest rates and rising prices .

documents.title: vw offers diesel buyback deal in germany
text: volkswagen has offered its customers in germany a buyback deal on its diesel cars to try to reassure them that they would n't be affected by any possible driving bans due to emissions , reports bbc world service .

it has guaranteed customers buying new or year-old diesels from authorised dealers that they 'll be able to sell them back at an independently-determined price , in order to buy a less-polluting vw model in the future .
a german court ruled recently that cities can introduce bans for the worst-polluting diesel cars - something that car manufacturers and the government insist may not be necessary .

documents.title: reality check : your brexit questions answered
text: reality check : your brexit questions answered
author: Chris Morris
Reality Check correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: slowest growth since 2012
text: 1.4 % growth in # gdp in q4 2017 compared with q4 2016 , the slowest growth rate since q2 2012
`` the slowest growth rate since q2 2012 '' at a time when the rest of the g20 are growing faster .
yet leavers keep trying to tell us that the economy is doing well !
guess what , without brexit it would be doing substantially better !

documents.title: uk current account gap smallest since 2011
text: the ons also said that the uk 's current account showed the deficit with the rest of the world narrowed to £ 82.9bn or 4.1 % of in 2017 - the smallest gap since 2011 .
in the fourth quarter , the current account deficit shrank to £ 18.4bn , or 3.6 % of gdp , down from £ 19.2bn in the previous three months .

documents.title: businesses count down to brexit deal
text: businesses count down to brexit deal
author: Brian Meechan
BBC Wales business correspondent

documents.title: construction supports uk gdp
text: uk gdp growth over the full year was revised up marginally to 1.8 % , according to the office for national statistics .
the construction sector performed better than previous estimates suggested .
output grew by 0.1 % in the fourth quarter of 2017 , which was revised upwards from a previous reading of a 0.7 % fall .

documents.title: uk car production falls 17 %
text: news - uk car production falls as domestic demand slumps

documents.title: westfield takeover gets the go-ahead
text: australia 's foreign investment regulator has cleared unibail-rodamco 's proposed $ 16bn ( £ 11.4bn ) buy-out of shopping centre company westfield .
unibail-rodamco - europe 's biggest property firm - bid for westfield in december in an effort to defend itself against online competition coming from the likes of amazon .
in the uk , westfield 's shopping centres include those located in stratford and white city .

documents.title: breakinguk gdp growth unchanged at 0.4 %
text: uk gdp grew at 0.4 % between october and december , according to the office for national statistics , representing no to change to its second estimate of growth .

documents.title: house price growth 'subdued '
text: annual house price growth remained subdued in march , according to the nationwide building society .
the increase of 2.1 % was down slightly from february 's rate of 2.2 % .
nationwide said `` subdued consumer confidence '' and wage growth failing to keep up with the rise in the cost of living had offset healthy employment gains and low borrowing costs .
but it expects house prices to hold steady in 2018 due to low unemployment and lack of properties on the market .

robert gardner , nationwide 's chief economist , said : `` looking ahead , much will depend on how broader economic conditions evolve , especially in the labour market , but also with respect to interest rates . ''

documents.title: economic well-being will 'take precedence '
text: if all goes according to the eu-uk plan , by march next year they will have a completed withdrawal agreement under their belt .

international trade secretary liam fox thinks an acceptable deal will be reached : `` we have a £ 17bn surplus in services with the european union , the european union has a £ 102bn surplus with the uk , so it would be very damaging to businesses in europe not to come to a deal .

`` therefore i think that the economic well-being of the people of europe , of the businesses of europe , workers of europe will ultimately take precedence in these negotiations over the politics of every closer union . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'my business has changed since brexit vote '
text: 'my business has changed since brexit vote '

documents.title: how will 30 march 2019 be different ?
text: international trade secretary liam fox is also taking part in the today programme 's countdown to brexit discussions .
he 's asked what practical difference people will actually notice on 30 march 2019 , post-brexit .
`` as far as trade goes we will have the ability - which we do n't have at the present time - to negotiate future trade agreements with countries outside the european union , '' he says .

`` we will also have an independent seat on the world trade organisation which will give us the ability to shape the global trading environment in a way that we want to see , which is a a more open and more liberal global trading environment to ensure that free trade brings the benefits to the next generation that we 've enjoyed , including taking a billion people out of poverty in the last generation . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: shire shares fall
text: trading is fairly subdued in uk stocks on thursday .
gkn 's share price is up 1 % at 427.5p while melrose industries ' stock is marginally ahead at 223.5p .
shire pharmaceuticals ' share price is down 1.46 % at £ 34.49 after wednesday 's huge rise when japan 's takeda revealed it was considering making an offer for the business .
the wider ftse 100 is up 16.43 points at 7,061.17 .
supermarket chain wm morrison leads the risers , up 1.87 % at 212.4p .
catering giant compass group is the biggest faller , down 2.1 % at £ 14.53 .
the ftse 250 is up 87.87 points at 19,444.46 .

documents.title: why the the gkn bid battle matters
text: later we will find out whether the owner of a company with 260 years of engineering and innovation history will throw its lot in with a company that likes to run businesses for less than five .
melrose 's pursuit of gkn is the first hostile takeover bid to go the distance for nearly a decade and , as such , is an important litmus test of the brand of capitalism at work in the uk today .

as we contemplate the takeover of a venerable name with 60,000 employees by a smaller company that is much loved by the markets but mistrusted by unions and many politicians , the ghosts of kraft , cadbury , bhs and the smoke from the still smouldering wreck of carillion hover in the mind .
these were all very different disasters but there are some common denominators which are at play in the melrose-gkn tussle .
read simon 's full blog here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: asia markets trade higher
text: iin asia , markets were in positive territory .
in japan , the benchmark nikkei 225 gained 0.6 % to close at 21,159.08 points .
hong kong 's hang seng is up 89.91 points or 0.30 % at 30,112.56 .

documents.title: listen : brexit and your household
text: with a year to brexit , has there been a noticeable impact on household spending ?
# britainatthecrossroads

must buy british made will gradually restore uk `` socioeconomy '' worth the struggle to regain sanctity of individual & individual rights ( forfeited to nwo-fincorpscontrollrdgovttyranny-richthrive-wrkrsstruggle-poordepriveddie ; look what eu did uknhs robbed it dry ! ! )
yes
yes people are being careful and european holidays will take a hit next year .

documents.title: brexit transition could be 'no longer than a few weeks '
text: back at nifco uk in stockton-on-tees , john longworth , co-chair of leave means leave and former head of the british chambers of commerce , is also on today .
he told business presenter dharshini david that did n't believe the 21 month brexit transition period was needed .

`` i still believe that the government could have a deal with the european union which would not require a transition period , the transition period being quite a dangerous period of time for the uk because we 'll be a rule-taker will be a vassal state of the european union , '' he said .

`` what the government need to do is set out very clearly what the post-brexit economy will look like and all the good things that will happen to give business confidence , strike a canada- style deal with the eu , which the eu have said they would accept and therefore could be done quickly , which would cover the vast majority of products , 98 % of products would be covered . ''
`` we could then get on and leave within a few weeks so the transition period would be no longer than a few weeks , '' he added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: nissan and renault 'in merger talks '
text: bloomberg is reporting that nissan and renault are in talks to merge and create a new company .
shares in france 's renault jumped by 7.24 % in response to the speculation .
renault owns 43 % of nissan .
conversely , nissan has a 15 % stake in renault .

documents.title: london shares edge up
text: in london the benchmark ftse 100 share index were slightly ahead at the open , rising 8 points or 0.12 % at 7,052.95 .
the mid-cap ftse 250 was up 57 points or 0.29 % at 19,413.40 .

documents.title: nice work if you can get itthe telegraph 's executive business editor ben marlow tweets
text: michael spencer agrees to sell nex to chicago exchange giant for £ 3.9bn , in a deal that values his stake at a whopping £ 669m .
spencer staying on as special ambassador for minimum of two years .
london to become cme 's european hq in big brexit boost to city .
here 's our early take on the deal

documents.title: get set for a complicated year
text: when considering any difficult conundrum , it is often worth stating the obvious first .
both sides in the negotiations between britain and the european union say they want a deal on trade once brexit has happened .
both have said they want that deal to be comprehensive - `` deep and special '' according to the uk .
both have signalled they are willing to give ground to achieve their desired outcome .
read kamal 's blog here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: airbnb to send customer data to china 's government
text: airbnb is to start sending customer information gathered by its china-based operation to the chinese government .
information shared with the authorities will include customers ' passport details and booking dates .
details about people listing accommodation would also be passed on once they started accepting bookings .
read more here .

documents.title: have your say : brexit and the bbc
text: # bbcfeedback has a brexit special coming up - what do you think about how brexit has been dealt with on bbc radio ?
the # remain lobby represented 48 % of voters at the referendum .
setting aside any arguments over govt actions since , it is clear to anyone watching developments that remaining in the eu is still very much a option .
the bbc have chosen to completely ignore this and the 48 % .
this has framed their response and reports .
by denying this reality they have become political activists promoting the leave cause and preventing the greater population being exposed to the total reality of our situation .
this in turn is undermining our democratic process .
on the rare occasions the remain side is given any space it is subjected to ill mannered bullying by both presenters and other guestswho in turn talk unchallenged .
this would be bad enough , however the failure of bbc presenters and journalists to fact check or challenge the
blatant disinformation ( aka lies ) put forward by many in the leave campaigns doubles down on the inequality .
as the lies and realities of our situation unfold and those in the leave campaigns have started to be exposed it has been ignored .
the inescapable truth is that we
will , as a country , be much worse off if brexit is allowed to go ahead .
those who insisted it would be the easiest thing in the world need to be brought to book .
that is the bbcs job , to expose truth .
now , as the biggest lie of all is being exposed elsewhere , silence .
so well put !
thank you !
appalling and frightening .

i no longer watch/listen to any bbc news/politics.confusing 'balance ' with letting the ill informed and blatantly extreme dominate debate.failing to acknowledge and cover the concerns of 'remain'supporters .
dreadful biased presenters eg humphreys .
encouraging a 'win/lose ' style of debate ( makes better radio/ telly ? ) .
presenters and guests talk over and shout down points being made .
failure to challenge and correct basic factual errors.failure to report on events etc important to remainers .
i could go on- bloody dreadful2/2
yet no one from the bbc seems to be accountable , or required to face scrutiny for how they report & present news & current affairs .
the dg ( if that 's still the correct title ) is tony hall but he 's completely invisible , so too it seems are the rest of their senior management team
i have thought for a while the whole thing just does n't reallly stack up .
watched bbc all my life and do n't remember them hiding from other momentous issues even if it brought them into conflict with govt of the day .
eg poll tax , miners strike , iraq war etc 1/2
maybe it 's my distorted memory ?
maybe the lack of alternative media meant that actually i wansnt getting the full story - just a bbc version but did n't even know ?
it 's possible but my spider senses tell me this is weird 2/2
i get the same feeling maxine !
only about brexit though !
something funny going on here , think they 've been warned off by government !
you could be forgiven for concluding that i think i always trusted the bbc - not perfect but largely open and fair i always thought .
the divisive nightmare that is brexit has got it 's tentacles into everything
same here !
the bbc news was my 'go to ' when i wanted to catch up on events !
sadly or correctly i now question everything by cross referencing as far as possible !
i always thought george orwell was right about 1984 he just got the year wrong !
on news , any questions and today , bbcr4 has allowed the views of hard brexiteers to be spoken unchallenged .
for months they spoke about wto rules being perfect for our needs , seldom with any challenge from interviewers .
the same voices are heard over and over again : farage , lawson , tim martin , dyson .
their continued appearances make people think that many people share their views , which is just not true .
r4 is doing little to educate and inform .
on today this morning , for example , the emphasis is on light weight articles about coming to terms with brexit , with little focus on the huge challenges in negotiations before then .

john humphrys frequently talks about parliament 's decision ( they have n't made one ) , the overwhelming decision to leave ( 52 % ) , and never engages with then tough issues such as continuity of trade agreements .

opinion polls have shown consistently over months that over half the country think that brexit is a bad decision , but on r4 those with pro-eu views are sidelined , represented by minorities on panels , heckled by interviewers .
there has been little or no coverage of the pro-eu marches , in which tens of thousands of people have participated on multiple occasions .
r4 commentators confine themselves to talking to mps and spokesmen , do n't take notice of grass roots .
the investigations into cambridge analytica machinations represent , if proved , the greatest threat to our democracy in recent years , and the lack of coverage on r4 is shocking .
cricket cheating has received more attention .
when was the last time r4 did any challenging , penetrating investigation ?
certainly has n't happened with brexit .
look at faisal islam 's brexit coverage , or channel 4 , and cry .
news is not just about collecting sound bites from your usual go-to politicians .

documents.title: nissan relocation 'would hit sales '
text: about 35 % of nifco uk 's sales are to the nissan plant at sunderland .

if the car maker were to move elsewhere - which mike matthews said he could n't imagine - nifco would `` lose those sales because margins are so tight everywhere and everywhere is competing for the same business i would suspect that if we saw a uk business moving to mainland europe we 'd see the supply chain go with it . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: brexit : what workers think
text: the today programme is broadcasting live from car parts maker nifco uk in stockton-on-tees and has been asking employees what they think about brexit as britain heads towards the 29 march 2019 deadline
`` relief that it 's all over . ''
this is how nifco factory workers will feel one year from now .
sonya francis voted to remain in the eu but now she says she will get behind brexit to `` move forward '' # r4today
absolutely disheartening response from factory workers on brexit : there 's nothing we can do about it . ''
how did they get themselves into this situation ?
by voting in that referendum !
i 'm so sick of this drip , drip softening up for us up for brexit crap .
from the failure of tv news to cover the ca scandal to this .
the bbc brand is now i fear seriously damaged .
irreparably damaged for me .
yes , i think for me also .
i am not a bbc basher , and across the spectrum from in our time , to timewatch or horizon , it has enriched my life .
but news division is at its heart and it has failed abysmally
she thinks it will all be over in march 2019 does she ? !
interview her again in 18 months & see what she thinks then
she 'll say it 's all the fault of the eu .
yep she will .
that 's the line that will be taken by the press & the quitlings when it all starts falling apart .
i still like to think that at the back of some brexiters ' minds there would be nagging doubt about what they 've done , but that 's probably wishful thinking !
democracy & individual rights more important longterm than any seeming shortterm `` candy-teaser '' to comply with vlobalists-bilderburgs-agendas
i voted remain and still want to stay .
our government are not acting in the national interest
what a saint .
millions who voted remain will never get behind brexit - especially as vote leave cheated .
people will come to regret this very much when they pay with their jobs
she works in manufacturing in the ne good luck lady !
it 's a very very brave sacrifice that the people of stockton are making for brexit .
but be brave , be brave
it wo n't be over , there will just be more and more economic pain .
why not get behind your country ?
singapore requires all residents to do national service .
maybe we should do the same to get people to understand whose side they are on ?
bot
astonished that the impact analysis ( everywhere worse off ) was n't mentioned in this segment .
warehouse worker : `` we can see the effect already , less going out the door '' # bbc : `` never mind that , everyone is just weary , yes ?
just wants to get on with it .
i am putting words in your mouths , just agree with our party line , ffs ! ''
sonya : `` we should just move forward '' # fbpe
sonya is yet another victim of misinformation , i 'm afraid .
piotr urban and his wife are polish .
they have been in the uk for 13 years .
he thinks there should be stronger assurances from the government on rights for eu nationals post-brexit # r4today
why ?
if he 's that worried , he could apply for british citizenship !
remember to ask him hard questions , then allow mr mogg an unchallenged 20 minute monologue in reply .
great confidence in the uk .
i 'm sure they would be welcome to take british citizenship , then there 'd be no problem .
the government are still fudging the issue .
open borders and membership of the schengen is a sensible way round the problems .
so why are there : austrian soldiers on the brennan pass ?
foreign legion soldiers in the alps ?
armed guards on the danish border ?
razor wire fences in poland and visguard states ?
it is each countries choice and that has always been so .
they all have their own issues .
denmark is in the schengen and you can drive or walk across with no stopping .
switzerland has got each citizen armed and ready .
poland has issues of its own .
yes , they all have issues but my point is that open borders and schengen is n't sensible .
certainly not in todays eu
then we must disagree .
i would rather strenghthen our borders to the rest of the world .
formerly working for the government i can see that we no longer have the money to pay the staff for total border survelliance .
, ,yet we have taken possession of the first of 6 state of the art border protection vessels .
the eu have failed to protect our borders and pay billions of euros to turkey to do the job for them and re-introduce border controls in shegen ( sensible ? )
why ?
poland is an old ally , we went to war for them in 1939 but why should a foreigner have the right to live in our beautiful vibrant country if we do n't have the same right ?

documents.title: nifco boss 'worried ' ahead of brexit
text: more from nifco 's boss , mike matthews now
`` if we do a deal where we do n't have import tariffs and export tariffs that would be great that 's what manufacturing really needs , '' he reckons .
today presenter mishal hussain asked if he was worried as he looked around the factory which employs 650 staff .
`` yes , i 'm worried , '' he said .
`` i have n't heard a clear sign that we 're going to be in a position post-brexit that enables us to be as competitive within europe as were were prior to brexit . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: nex agrees £ 3.9bn takeover by cme
text: nex group , the inter-dealer broker previously known as icap , has announced that it will be taken over us exchange operator cme group .
nex 's founder and chief executive michael spencer will join the cme board and will remain with the combined company as a special adviser .

documents.title: thousands of jobs at risk at conviviality
text: conviviality , which owns bargain booze , bargain booze select convenience and wine rack , employs some 2,500 people .
the company is also a supplier to companies such as pubs group wetherspoons .
it had been facing a £ 30m tax bill but attempts to raise £ 125m from investors failed .

documents.title: conviviality may appoint administrators within 10 days
text: conviviality said following discussions with its lending banks , `` the board has resolved to file notice of intention to appoint administrators to the company '' .
it said that unless circumstances change `` the board intend to appoint administrators within 10 business days .
the secured creditors can , however , appoint administrators without the requirement for notice . ''

it said : `` the directors intend to allow the business to continue to trade and the company continues to work alongside advisers in order to preserve as much value as possible for all stakeholders as it explores a number of inbound enquiries regarding a potential sale of all or parts of the business . ''

documents.title: breakingconviviality set to file for administration
text: bargain booze owner conviviality has announced it will file for administration after failing to secure emergency funding .

documents.title: risking business suicide
text: in stockton-on-tees , today presenter mishal hussain is on the factory floor at plastic component supplier nifco uk .
most of the products they make end up in vehicles in mainland europe .
boss mike matthews tells her : `` if we do anything that damages business prospects or take a course of action that makes us uncompetitive , that 's business suicide .
`` in manufacturing you do n't see very sudden changes - it 's all about long term planning , long term investment . ''
he thinks the uk needs to come out of brexit with the same level of competitiveness and same level of profitability as before brexit .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'eu values uk fishing industry more '
text: plymouth fisheries is the second largest fish market in the uk and that 's where wake up to money is broadcasting from this morning as britain steps into the final year before the country leaves the european union .

alison pessell , company secretary at plymouth trawler agencies , says that the firm is `` bitterly disappointed '' with the transition arrangement for the fishing industry which she said was `` totally unnecessary '' .
she says that because nothing will change during the agreed 21 month period after the uk leaves the eu , the company is slowing down its investment plans .
she says : `` hopefully whichever government is in that position will be trying to get a better deal in 21 months time .
`` however , it seems europe values our fishing resource more than our own country does . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: looking ahead to brexit
text: the today programme is broadcasting from car parts maker nifco uk as britain moves into the final year before it officially leaves the eu .
coming up
this morning : it 's a year until britain leaves the eu and we 're live in car parts factory @ twitterid in teesside .
shadow chancellor john mcdonnell ( 0710 ) .
international trade sec liam fox ( 0810 ) .
tony blair on e-identities ( 0830 ) # r4today
going to mention vote leaves alkeged electoral fraud today ?
should be pretty central to any brexit reporting
@ twitterid sacked for dodgy dealings with america , @ twitterid linked to war crimes , racism , selling uk assets , wants to keep eu undemocratic oligarchy
why is blair suddenly getting so much airtime on various issues ?
so you have two `` pros '' at the key interview points .
is this # bbcbias or just appalling editorship ?
john mcdonnell sniggering and barking like a caricature villain - extraordinary .
just go back and listen to your own programme where you speak to @ twitterid stop this tiresome '' approach of sounding dismissive .
brexit is not a done deal , do you know that ?
@ twitterid
who cares for blair !
war criminals given air time disgraceful

documents.title: when tax becomes taxing
text: why is conviviality , the owner of bargain booze , facing administration ?
fidelity international 's sonja laud tells wake up to money that it is down to a couple of elements .
she says firstly the fall in consumer spending `` finally seems to have caught up with the drinks industry '' .
secondly , she points out a £ 30m tax bill which `` was brought to the attention to investors rather late , very close to when it had to be paid '' .
she says it is `` an interesting element because you would wonder why they have not brought this to their attention earlier '' .

documents.title: live from stockton-on-tees
text: live from stockton-on-tees

documents.title: 'huge amount ' for business to do ahead of brexit
text: what challenges is brexit causing for britain in the north east of england ?

`` there needs to be a lot more done about training people , right the way across of every single sector because we have been relying so much on migrant labour from europe , '' said james ramsbotham , chief executive of the north east chambers of commerce .
`` many service sector businesses trading around europe are going to have to think about registering for vat in every country .
they 're going to have to look at all their contracts to work out just what the changes are going to be . ''
`` there 's a huge amount of work to be done , '' he told the today programme .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: explained : 365 days to brexit
text: explained : 365 days to brexit

documents.title: key points in gkn battle
text: with the deadline to decide gkn 's fate literally just hours away , sonja laud , head of equity at fidelity international , says investors in the engineering group should consider three things when deciding whether to vote for or against the £ 8.1bn offer from melrose .
she tells wake up to money : `` here , in particular , which management team do we think is better equipped to raise profitability which has always been an issue .

`` if you look at margin levels then i think there 's a fair point to say 'okay , they should be higher ' then pension issues and debt levels - i think that 's the three main points that should be the framework for investors to assess . ''
she says that shareholders should then look at the two different plans on the table .
`` who do we think is better equipped to manage the assets going forward ? ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: the eu 's view of the 'brexit day ' countdown
text: the eu 's view of the 'brexit day ' countdown
author: Katya Adler
Europe editor

documents.title: something fishy in plymouth
text: radio 5 live 's guy kilty is broadcasting live from plymouth fisheries this morning as the uk heads towards the final 12 months before the country leaves the eu .
what does the fishing industry think about the fact that they will not regain control of britain 's fishing waters on 29 march 2019 ?
and will we see any mps popping up to chuck fish in the water ?
all set for # wakeuptomoney from @ twitterid on @ twitterid # brexit
up bright and early at # plymouth # fisheries for # wakeuptomoney and # 5livebreakfast this morning to talk # brexit # fishing # ferries # tourism # retail and much more .
join me from 05:15 .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: in other news
text: on this day highlighting major deadlines , another one is closing in fast - gkn investors have until lunchtime today to either support or reject a £ 8.1bn hostile takeover offer from melrose .
the bbc 's jamie robertson has written about why this deal is so important for the uk , which you can read here .
on the subject of bids , watch out for shire pharmaceuticals ' share price when the stock market opens at 8.00am .
on wednesday , japanese rival takeda disclosed that it was considering a bid for the dublin-based company .
takeda 's shareholders have sent its stock down 6.62 % on the nikkei overnight .
the office for national statistics will release its final reading for uk gdp growth for the fourth quarter at 9.30am .
and today may be the day when thousands of people who work for bargain booze-owner conviviality will learn the fate of the business .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to business live and a key day for the uk - one year from now britain will leave the european union .
as the final countdown begins , we 'll be looking at how businesses ' brexit plans are progressing and what they believe still needs to be done before the 29 march , 2019 deadline .
as always , we 'd love to hear your thoughts .
email us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
